title: The Alternative C.V: what should it look like?
description: This is our workshop proposal for the Recognition & Rewards festival, to be held in Utrecht on 2023.04.13. It was already accepted in January, and we're sharing it now as we are preparing the session.

main.name: Call for workshops Recognition & Rewards Festival.docx

workspace.bio:
Daan Rutten is the Coordinator of Open Science at Tilburg University. He studied Culture Studies at Tilburg University and he obtained his PhD at the department of Modern Dutch Literature at the University of Utrecht. His dissertation concerns the play-element in the modernist literature
of the Dutch writer Willem Frederik Hermans, and the philosophy of Jacques Lacan and Slavoj Zizek. Rutten worked for the Huygens Institute in The Hague as an editor of the collected volumes of Hermans. He is preparing the biography of Jan Romein, and a book on the philosophy of play and politics. With Leon Hanssen, he founded the journal Into the Magic Circle, that will be deployed via Open Journals.

My research focuses on how the publishing system can facilitate improved quality of scholarly research. In particular, my research  explores modular publishing systems that break a research project into its building blocks. These building blocks are then sharing continuously and in chronological order, to provide a more accurate depiction of the research journey. I am currently director of the organization Liberate Science GmbH to implement this research finding into practice, and develop the practical use of it within a diverse set of research communities.

children.title: Design workshop "Alternative C.V.: what should it look like?"
children.description: These are our design workshop slides for the Recognition & Rewards festival, to be held in Utrecht on 2023.04.13. This in-person design workshop aims to brainstorm elements for a research CV (existing or future) and then create rough sketches for each element in groups. Finally, participants bring together these different elements into different alternative CVs, which can serve as the basis for mock-ups to be utilized in the future.

workspace.bio: My research focuses on how the publishing system can facilitate improved quality of scholarly research. In particular, my research  explores modular publishing systems that break a research project into its building blocks. These building blocks are then sharing continuously and in chronological order, to provide a more accurate depiction of the research journey. I am currently director of the organization Liberate Science GmbH to implement this research finding into practice, and develop the practical use of it within a diverse set of research communities.

Daan Rutten is the Coordinator of Open Science at Tilburg University. He studied Culture Studies at Tilburg University and he obtained his PhD at the department of Modern Dutch Literature at the University of Utrecht. His dissertation concerns the play-element in the modernist literature
of the Dutch writer Willem Frederik Hermans, and the philosophy of Jacques Lacan and Slavoj Zizek. Rutten worked for the Huygens Institute in The Hague as an editor of the collected volumes of Hermans. He is preparing the biography of Jan Romein, and a book on the philosophy of play and politics. With Leon Hanssen, he founded the journal Into the Magic Circle, that will be deployed via Open Journals.

children.title: Next step of: Proposal Open Science Conference 2023
children.description: New module based on: This is the abstract I submitted to the 2023 edition of the Open Science Conference. Specifically, I propose to talk about the first, second, and third waves of open research. It is a new idea I still have to expand on, so I'd love to hear thoughts if you have them. As of yet, the proposal is still pending but I thought I'd already share it with you 😊
